intro: Phyllostegia deltoidea, commonly known as the deltoid phyllostegia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, two-lipped flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, acidic soils along stream banks and in woodland areas. Phyllostegia deltoidea is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
